prefix: You have a PhD in mathematics.
problem_prompt:
You have a PhD in mathematics.
I have 6 shirts, 4 pairs of pants, and 6 hats. The pants come in tan, black, blue, and gray. The shirts and hats come in those colors, and also white and yellow. I refuse to wear an outfit in which all 3 items are the same color. How many choices for outfits, consisting of one shirt, one hat, and one pair of pants, do I have?
solution: The number of all outfit combinations is $6\times 4\times 6=144$. There are 4 outfits in which all three items are the same color. Thus there are $144-4=\boxed{140}$ outfits in which not all three items are the same color.
gpt_response:
ChatCompletion(id='chatcmpl-9A2dRut6qj07tQ9KqzBfsVR4eHCt9', choices=[Choice(finish_reason='stop', index=0, logprobs=None, message=ChatCompletionMessage(content='To find the total number of outfit choices, we break it down into cases based on the colors of the items:

Case 1: All items are different colors
Number of choices = 6 (shirt choices) * 6 (hat choices) * 4 (pants choices) = 144

Case 2: Two items are the same color
Number of choices = 6 (shirt choices) * 6 (hat choices) * 4 (pants choices) * 3 (ways to choose which item is the same color) = 864

So the total number of outfit choices is 144 + 864 = 1008.', role='assistant', function_call=None, tool_calls=None))], created=1712180437, model='gpt-3.5-turbo-0125', object='chat.completion', system_fingerprint='fp_b28b39ffa8', usage=CompletionUsage(completion_tokens=132, prompt_tokens=100, total_tokens=232))
